title: Angie Kent denies rumours had cosmetic work to prepare for The Bachelorette
text:
She's been open about her love for Botox and facial treatments in the past.

But Angie Kent, 30, claims she steered clear of undergoing extra cosmetic work in preparation for her appearance on The Bachelorette.

'I've had the same work for the last four years, but all of a sudden everyone is saying I've changed my face for the show,' she told Monday's NW magazine.

'I've just lost weight!' Angie Kent, 30, (pictured) has denied rumours had cosmetic work to prepare for The Bachelorette

'That's 100 per cent not true. I've just lost weight, no extra work,' the former Gogglebox star said.

Angie isn't the first Bachelorette to have been plagued by cosmetic surgery rumours.

Last year, Ali Oetjen sparked debate among fans with her suspiciously plump pout and very taut visage on the show.

Not the first! Last year, Ali Oetjen sparked debate among fans with her suspiciously plump pout and very taut visage on The Bachelorette

'Her face isn't moving!' Interestingly, Angie commented on Ali's appearance while watching The Bachelorette premiere on Gogglebox, exclaiming: 'I can't tell [that Ali is excited] because [her] face isn't moving!'

Interestingly, Angie commented on Ali's appearance while watching The Bachelorette premiere on Gogglebox, exclaiming: 'I can't tell [that Ali is excited] because [her] face isn't moving!'

Many reality stars have expressed regrets about undergoing extreme cosmetic work prior to appearing on television.

In April this year, Married At First Sight's Jessika Power had her lip fillers dissolved after she was mercilessly mocked online for her protruding pout.

Plumped at first sight? MAFS stars Tracey Jewel (left) and Jessika Power (right) have both expressed regret after undergoing cosmetic work ahead of their reality television debuts

'I'm not going to deny it': Fellow reality star Keira Maguire (pictured) has also admitted she may have been too zealous with fillers ahead of her debut on Bachelor In Paradise last year

Married At First Sight's Tracey Jewel also famously had $9,000 worth of facial filler dissolved last year after being subjected to trolling over her appearance on the show.

'Nothing like watching yourself on TV to realise you’ve overdone the filler!' she wrote on Instagram at the time.

Fellow reality star Keira Maguire has also admitted she may have been too zealous with fillers ahead of her debut on Bachelor In Paradise last year.

'Maybe I had a bit too much lip filler before the show, you will see it,' the blonde beauty told The Sunday Telegraph.

'I'm not going to deny it and I may have some regrets about it when I see it, but what am I going to do?' she said.
description: She's been open about her love for Botox and facial treatments in the past.
authors: Monique Friedlander For Daily Mail Australia
